responsibleParty.title: 1. Data Controller
content: The controller responsible for the processing of personal data on this website is:
Nexora
Email: nexora-ai+markus@obermui.de

dataCollection.title: 2. Collection and Storage of Personal Data
content: We process personal data that you voluntarily provide to us when using our website. This includes in particular:
- Uploaded files (e.g., PDF documents)
- Text inputs
- Registration and account data (e.g., email address, username)
This data is processed solely for the creation and provision of your personalized user account and for the use of the offered functions.

purpose.title: 3. Purpose and Legal Basis of Processing
content: The processing of your personal data is based on Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR (contract performance) and Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest in providing our services securely and user-friendly).
Further processing will only take place with your explicit consent (Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR).

storage.title: 4. Storage and Deletion of Data
content: Your data will only be stored for as long as is necessary for the fulfillment of the aforementioned purposes or as required by law.
Upon request, we will delete your data at any time, unless statutory retention periods prevent this.

dataSharing.title: 5. Data Sharing
content: Your data will not be shared with third parties unless this is necessary for the performance of the contract, required by law, or you have given your explicit consent.

dataSecurity.title: 6. Data Security
content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures in accordance with Art. 32 GDPR to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk. These include in particular encryption, access restrictions, and regular review of our security measures.

yourRights.title: 7. Your Rights
content: You have the right to:
- Request information about your personal data stored by us,
- Request rectification of incorrect data,
- Request erasure of your data,
- Request restriction of processing,
- Object to processing,
- Withdraw your consent at any time with effect for the future,
- Lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority (Art. 77 GDPR).
To exercise these rights, you can contact us at any time using the contact details provided above.

changes.title: 8. Changes to this Privacy Policy
content: We reserve the right to update this privacy policy as necessary to adapt to changed legal requirements or changes to our services.
Last updated: August 2025
